generations.name: A Car (Original Fleet)
generations.description: The original A Cars were the first fleet of BART vehicles, featuring a distinctive space-age design. They served the system for over 50 years before being replaced by the Fleet of the Future.

generations.name: B Car (Expansion Fleet)
generations.description: The B Cars were ordered in the 1990s to expand the fleet for increased ridership. They featured updated electronics and improved climate control systems.

generations.name: C Car (C1/C2)
generations.description: The C Cars were the last vehicles to use the original BART car design. They introduced improved accessibility features and updated passenger information displays.

generations.name: Fleet of the Future
generations.description: The Fleet of the Future represents a complete modernization of BART's rolling stock. These cars feature a new interior design with wider aisles, digital displays, LED lighting, and improved ventilation. The entire legacy fleet is being replaced by these new vehicles.

generations.name: Oakland Airport Connector
generations.description: The Oakland Airport Connector uses automated cable-driven vehicles to connect the Coliseum BART station to Oakland International Airport. The system operates without on-board operators.
